project_abstract.cdata: The Economic Capacity Building Technical Assistance (ECTAC) Project for Mongolia will assist to design and implement a public sector management reform program aimed at improving budgetary and public expenditure management systems and processes; and civil service and public administration performance. There are three components to the project. Component 1) The first component of the ECTAC will focus on improving budget preparation, execution and monitoring systems and processes. It will focus on assisting the government implement a medium term expenditure framework at the central and agency level, improve budget execution through the full roll out of the GFMIS system throughout government, and assist in refining the overall legal framework for procurement. The ECTAC will provide assistance in the areas mentioned below. Sub-Component (i) Disciplining budget preparation, policy planning, and budget formulation; Sub-Component (ii)  Enhancing budget and expenditure planning at the agency level; Sub-Component (iii) Improving budget execution and accountability systems; Sub-component (iv) Strengthening procurement at the central and agency levels; Sub-Component (v) Strengthening budget oversight and monitoring; Sub-Component (vi) Strengthening Accounting and internal audit capacity at the center and agency level: Component 2) will streamline and strengthen institutional arrangements and requisite capacity for civil service management, financing, coordination and accountability. This is proposed to be done through strengthening capacity for civil service management; establishing a human resource management and information system; and controlling the wage bill, and strengthening civil service accountability. Component 3) Implementation Arrangements - Project Coordination Unit will provide consulting services, training and equipment to support and build capacity.
